title: Chiropractic Care | Aurora Health Care
description: Chiropractic care for joint pain includes the best available treatments - like chiropractic adjustment and light therapy - from experienced chiropractors.
cleaned_text: Helping you stay active without pain: Sports injuries and everyday wear and tear can be tough on your joints, including your knees and spine. Joint pain from these problems can make participating in activities painful - if not impossible. Seeing an Aurora chiropractor can help you feel better in as little as one visit. A chiropractor is a doctor who specializes in treating problems in your joints and nearby soft tissues. Chiropractic care uses hands-on techniques to relieve joint pain and restore normal functioning. Contrary to popular belief, this type of care isn't just for back problems - it can deliver lasting pain relief to joints all over the body. Chiropractic care is one of many treatments available through our integrative medicine program. Integrative medicine helps you overcome injury and illness naturally - without using drugs or surgery. Find out more about [integrative medicine](/services/integrative-medicine/). When you're in pain, it can be hard to get around. That's why we make it easy to get the care you need in one location. Our chiropractors often work in the same clinics as doctors, physical therapists and other specialists, coordinating all the details of your care so you can focus on getting better. Highlights of our chiropractic program include: Chiropractic care can help you get lasting relief from conditions that cause joint pain and muscle pain, including: Our chiropractors start by taking a closer look at the way you move. Your chiropractor may also apply gentle pressure to determine precisely which joints and supporting tissue need treatment. They'll then explain your treatment options and together make a plan to help you get lasting relief. Your treatment may include: We operate chiropractic clinics in Milwaukee, Sheboygan, Waukesha, Washington County and throughout eastern Wisconsin.
